content:
The sugar in honey is nothing like processed sugar—don’t confuse it with table sugar or high-fructose corn syrup. Rather, because bees collect from plant species far and wide, the fructose and glucose in honey are saturated with more than 200,000 undiscovered phytochemical compounds and agents, including pathogen-killers, phytochemicals that help protect you from radiation damage, and anti-cancerous phytochemicals.

Honey’s highly absorbable sugar and B12 coenzymes make it one of the most powerful brain foods of our time. Plus, raw honey helps repairs DNA and is extremely high in minerals such as calcium, potassium, zinc, selenium, phosphorus, chromium, molybdenum, and manganese.

Honey in its raw form is important for supporting immunity and a secret weapon to help with infectious illness. When you’re dealing with weakened immunity and feel like you’re extra susceptible to catching colds, flus, stomach bugs, and food poisoning, raw honey assists your body in keeping a strong first line of defense by strengthening neutrophils and macrophages so they can fight off pathogens. (It’s not yet documented by medical science that these and other white blood cells feed off of immune-stimulating phytochemicals.)

These properties also make raw honey anti-inflammatory—because it helps inhibit pathogens from procreating and thus releasing toxins that elevate inflammation.

How To Use:

Make Medical Medium Lemon, Honey, Ginger Water or simply add to lemon water. Enjoy on top of berries or other fruits. Add to smoothies, dips, or salad dressings. Add to warm (not hot) herbal teas. Chaga tea is especially beneficial when raw honey is added. Use raw honey as a replacement for any other processed sweetener.

For more information on the healing properties of raw honey and the symptoms and conditions it can help with, check out the New York Times best-selling book, Medical Medium Life-Changing Foods: Save Yourself and the Ones You Love with the Hidden Healing Powers of Fruits & Vegetables, and the other books in the Medical Medium series.

comments.content: I have triple the amount of B6nin my body. Not taking any supplements. Have all the pins and needles, body jumping, extreme dizziness. Can you tell me anything?

children.content: Julie Gruchy Voss I'm not a doctor, but I can provide some information based on available sources and clarify what the Medical Medium might say about these symptoms. Your symptoms—pins and needles, body jumping (likely muscle twitches or spasms), and extreme dizziness—are concerning and could be related to elevated vitamin B6 levels or other underlying issues. Since you mention having triple the normal amount of B6 in your body without taking supplements, this is unusual and may warrant further investigation, as dietary sources alone typically don’t cause such elevations.General Information on Vitamin B6 and SymptomsHigh levels of vitamin B6 (pyridoxine) can lead to toxicity, even though it’s rare without supplementation. Symptoms of B6 toxicity include:Peripheral neuropathy: Tingling, numbness, or pins and needles in the hands, feet, or other areas, caused by nerve damage.Dizziness and nausea: These can occur with prolonged high B6 intake, often at doses above 250 mg/day.Muscle twitching or spasms: These may be linked to nerve irritation or other neurological effects.Ataxia: Difficulty with coordination, sometimes accompanied by dizziness and tingling.Normally, B6 toxicity is associated with long-term use of high-dose supplements (e.g., >250 mg/day), but you’ve stated you’re not taking any. Possible explanations for elevated B6 without supplements include:Dietary factors: While rare, excessive consumption of B6-rich foods (e.g., fortified cereals, energy drinks) could contribute, though it’s unlikely to cause triple the normal levels.Metabolic issues: Some conditions or genetic factors might impair B6 metabolism, leading to accumulation.Testing errors or other conditions: Elevated B6 levels could be a lab error, or symptoms might stem from another cause mimicking B6 toxicity, like heavy metal exposure, viral infections, or other nutrient deficiencies (e.g., B12 deficiency).Given the severity of your symptoms, it’s critical to consult a healthcare provider to confirm B6 levels (via blood test, typically measuring pyridoxal 5'-phosphate) and rule out other causes like neuropathy, multiple sclerosis, or heavy metal toxicity.Medical Medium’s PerspectiveThe Medical Medium (Anthony William) attributes neurological symptoms like pins and needles, body jumping (tics/spasms), and dizziness to causes unrelated to B6 toxicity, focusing instead on viral infections and environmental factors. According to his writings:Neurological symptoms such as tingling, numbness, spasms, and dizziness are often caused by Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) or shingles virus (herpes zoster). He claims these viruses inflame nerves or the brain, leading to symptoms like pins and needles, muscle twitches, and vertigo.Inflammation: Numbness and tingling may result from nerve swelling or brain inflammation caused by these viruses.Heavy metals: He suggests that heavy metal toxicity (e.g., mercury, aluminum) can contribute to neurological symptoms, including tremors and dizziness.Healing approach: The Medical Medium recommends dietary changes and supplements to address these issues, such as:Foods: Celery juice, wild blueberries, and leafy greens to detoxify and support nerve health.Supplements: B12 (methylcobalamin), zinc, and lemon balm for antiviral and nerve support.He does not specifically address elevated B6 levels or B6 toxicity as a cause of these symptoms, focusing instead on viral or toxic triggers. His approach is not backed by conventional medical evidence, as it relies on intuitive claims rather than scientific studies.Reconciling Your SituationYour symptoms align with both B6 toxicity (per conventional medicine) and the Medical Medium’s description of neurological issues, but the causes differ:B6 Toxicity: If blood tests confirm triple the normal B6 levels, this could explain your symptoms. Since you’re not taking supplements, a doctor should investigate why B6 is elevated (e.g., metabolic disorders, kidney issues, or lab errors). Stopping B6-rich foods (e.g., fortified cereals, bananas, chickpeas) and staying hydrated may help, but medical guidance is essential. Recovery from B6 toxicity can take weeks to months after reducing intake.Medical Medium’s View: He’d likely attribute your symptoms to a viral cause (EBV or shingles) or heavy metal toxicity, not B6. His recommendations involve detox protocols and antiviral supplements, which may not address B6-related issues and could even worsen them if supplements contain B6.RecommendationsSee a Doctor: Get a comprehensive evaluation, including:Repeat B6 blood test to confirm levels.Tests for other deficiencies (e.g., B12, magnesium) or conditions (e.g., neuropathy, MS, heavy metal exposure).Neurological exam to assess nerve function.Avoid B6 Sources: Temporarily reduce intake of B6-rich foods and check labels for fortified products.Skepticism of Medical Medium: While his dietary suggestions (e.g., celery juice) are generally harmless, his viral theory lacks scientific support. Avoid his supplements if they contain B6, as they could exacerbate symptoms.Monitor Symptoms: Track your symptoms’ frequency and severity to share with your doctor.If you want to explore the Medical Medium’s protocols further, I can provide more details on his recommended foods or supplements. However, given your confirmed high B6 levels, a medical approach targeting that is likely more relevant.

Teresa Harris thank you!! Everything you said is right. And I have been diagnosed with EVB, and shingles last year, but I didn’t have pain. Do you mind if I re read what you just sent me and get back to you. I have had the blood tested for B6 twice, 12/24, and 4/25. Very out of range. Again , thank you very much.

Julie Gruchy Voss Have you been able to get Anthony William’s books? (On Amazon or your library) Are you drinking celery juice? Have you cut out the trouble maker foods? Doing these things will put you on a path better health and healing yourself.

comments.content: I love honey- no refined sugar for 5 yrs , I often wonder if I'm taking too much in a day. How much is too much?

children.content: TA N JA beneficial amount of raw honey to consume is generally considered to be between 1 to 2 teaspoons (about 5-10 grams) per day. This amount can provide some of the potential benefits of honey, such as its antioxidant and antimicrobial properties, without exceeding the recommended daily limit for added sugars
